thag15.1:1.2: as I heard the teaching, so full of flavor.
thag15.1:2.3: They disturb one’s thoughts, it seems to me,
thag15.1:3.1: Just as a rain cloud would settle
thag15.1:3.2: the dust blown up by the wind,
thag15.1:4.2: when this is seen with wisdom
thag15.1:4.4: this is the path to purity.
thag15.1:5.2: when this is seen with wisdom
thag15.1:5.4: this is the path to purity.
thag15.1:6.2: when this is seen with wisdom
thag15.1:6.4: this is the path to purity.
thag15.1:7.1: The senior monk who was awakened right after the Buddha,
thag15.1:7.3: He has given up birth and death,
thag15.1:7.4: and has completed the spiritual journey.
thag15.1:8.1: There are floods, snares, and strong posts,
thag15.1:8.2: and a mountain hard to crack;
thag15.1:8.4: breaking the mountain so hard to break,
thag15.1:8.5: crossing over to the far shore,
thag15.1:8.6: one practicing absorption is freed from Māra’s bonds.
thag15.1:9.1: When a mendicant is haughty and fickle,
thag15.1:9.3: they sink down in the great flood,
thag15.1:10.1: But one who is steady and stable,
thag15.1:12.2: in the wilds, the formidable forest,
thag15.1:12.4: like an elephant at the head of the battle.
thag15.1:13.4: like a worker waiting for their wages.
thag15.1:15.3: The heavy burden is laid down,
thag15.1:15.4: the attachment to rebirth is eradicated.
thag15.1:16.2: for the sake of which I went forth
thag15.1:16.3: from the lay life to homelessness—
thag15.1:16.4: what use do I have for pupils?”
